# Exploratory Data Analysis


```{python}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false  
#| code-fold: true
#| results: hide

import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
from collections import Counter
import re

```

```{python}

#| echo: true
#| eval: false  
#| code-fold: true
#| results: hide

df = pd.read_csv("data/lightcast_job_postings.csv", encoding="utf-8", on_bad_lines='skip')

```


```{python}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false  
#| code-fold: true
#| fig-cap: "Job count by industry"
#| fig-align: center

industry_counts = df['NAICS_2022_2_NAME'].value_counts().reset_index()
industry_counts.columns = ['Industry', 'Job_Count']

plt.figure(figsize=(12, 8))
sns.barplot(data=industry_counts, x="Industry", y="Job_Count")
plt.title("Job Count by Industry (NAICS Level 2)")
plt.xticks(rotation=45, ha='right')
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("figurestyj/job_count_by_industry.png")
plt.show()

```


![](figurestyj/job_count_by_industry.png){width=100% fig-align='center'}




### Salary by State ??
```{python}
#| echo: true
#| eval: false  
#| code-fold: true
#| fig-align: center
#| fig-cap: "Top skills from job description"


job_descriptions = df['BODY'].dropna().tolist()
all_text = " ".join(job_descriptions).lower()

skills_keywords = ["python", "sql", "machine learning", "cloud", "aws",
                   "docker", "java", "excel", "r", "linux"]
skill_counts = Counter()

for skill in skills_keywords:
    matches = re.findall(rf"\b{re.escape(skill)}\b", all_text)
    skill_counts[skill] = len(matches)

top_skills_sorted = skill_counts.most_common(5)
skills, counts = zip(*top_skills_sorted)

plt.figure(figsize=(8, 4))
sns.barplot(x=list(skills), y=list(counts), palette="Blues_d")
plt.title("Top 5 In-Demand Skills from Job Descriptions")
plt.ylabel("Frequency")
plt.tight_layout()
plt.savefig("figurestyj/top_skills_from_description.png")
plt.show()

```
